main event: The report describes a UFO sighting on 13 June 1954 at Olmsted AFB in Middletown, Pa. The object was circular, hovered, and then moved towards the ESE. It was observed for a duration of 5 seconds before fading away into the distance. The size of the object was estimated to be about 15ft in diameter and appeared to be a balloon made of rubber with a string hanging from it.
interesting points: The object was observed to be spherical, silver in color, and about the size of a dime held at arm's length.
It was initially spotted moving very slowly in a westerly direction and disappeared after about three hours.
The witness described the object as appearing almost motionless, with varying intensities of light coming out of it and being maneuverable with changes in speed and altitude.
The sighting was witnessed by multiple reliable operators and military personnel.
The report mentioned the use of binoculars and indicated that the object was observed with bright daylight conditions.
sighted object: circular object hovering and moving towards ESE
witnesses: reliable operators, security indoctrination officer, chief tower operator, and others
photographs: yes, two exposed films of the object were taken
